channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024040679
item.description:
Report E-2024040679

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-10ft area of the concrete/asphalt lot and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released from one (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and used absorbent pads to collect the spent material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining material was transferred to a new 330-gallon poly drum and shipped onto the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050005
item.description:
Report E-2024050005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 19, 2024, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged due to being packed too tightly for transit. As a result, the bags released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the site. All loose product and the damaged bag were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.
